claim: AI Hub is a hub that provides AI-native GitHub Actions and standardization tools to improve development efficiency and quality across the organization.

Claude Code CLI runs on self-hosted runners and enables high-level automation (review, fixes, documentation generation) that understands context, which is impossible with traditional regex or static analysis.
A Composite Action combines multiple steps into a single reusable action definition using 'runs: using: composite'.
Each Action must have exactly ONE clear purpose. Multiple responsibilities (e.g., setup+test+deploy) are prohibited.
The review-and-merge action automatically fixes code issues using Claude Code CLI, rebases if needed, resolves conflicts, and merges the PR.
auto-fix is a boolean input (default: true) that determines whether the action should automatically fix issues found during review.
In AUTO FIX MODE, Claude executes with fix_prompt.txt, commits changes locally with message 'fix: auto-correction by Claude Code', and assumes LGTM (confidence=10) if execution succeeds.
When conflicts occur during rebase, the action resolves them by accepting the base branch version (git checkout --theirs) as a conservative approach.
The spec-to-code action generates code from Markdown specifications using Claude Code CLI.
The action-fixer action validates and auto-fixes common GitHub Actions workflow errors using yamllint and AI-powered fixes.
Actions must use strict version management with tags (v1, v2). @main references are prohibited for stability.
Template files are stored in actions/{action-name}/templates/ directory and use {VARIABLE_NAME} placeholders for substitution via sed.
Reusable workflow templates are explicitly excluded from this repository and are the responsibility of github-actions-templates repository.
Every action must have three components: (1) action.yml in actions/{name}/, (2) example in examples/{name}-example.yml, (3) guide in instructions/{name}.md
All actions must be usable from any repository in the organization without repository-specific dependencies.
Docker container actions and JavaScript actions are explicitly excluded. Only composite actions are in scope.
The lgtm-threshold input defines the minimum confidence score (1-10, default: 7) for auto-merge approval.
The merge-method input accepts three values: squash (default), merge, or rebase.
Publish PR action converts a draft pull request to ready for review using gh pr ready command.
preconditions: PR must exist in draft state

claim: Auto Merge PR action merges a pull request with specified method (squash, merge, rebase) and optionally enables auto-merge instead of immediate merge.
preconditions: PR must be reviewable and pass checks

claim: Review and Fix action reviews and automatically fixes code issues using Claude Code CLI. It was formerly part of review-and-merge but split to focus only on review and fix.
The review-and-merge action was split into three separate actions: review-fix, publish-pr, and auto-merge to follow single responsibility principle.

publish-pr and auto-merge actions violate Standard Action Structure because they lack example workflows (examples/publish-pr-example.yml, examples/auto-merge-example.yml) and instruction guides (instructions/publish-pr.md, instructions/auto-merge.md).

Every action must have three components: (1) action.yml in actions/{name}/, (2) example in examples/{name}-example.yml, (3) guide in instructions/{name}.md. AI agents must synchronize all three when creating or modifying actions.
